discussion.content: Answer is A. Operator is a choice list based on the field type. For example: is, is not, is one of, greater than, is different, is empty string, on, after, starts with etc

The incorrect answers are frustrating. This is just blatant.

Operator: a choice list based on the field type. For example, in the Incident [incident] table, the greater than operator does not apply to the Active field but it does apply to the Priority field.
A is correct
A is the answer

A Role is a collection of permissions in the now platform to grant access to applications and other parts of the platform.

questions.question_text: Which would NOT appear in the History section of the Application Navigator?

discussion.content: Records are not tracked

A has to be the correct one. If you search for a UI page, list or form, then when you go to history those will appear. The record is the table's entry and is not seen (tracked) individually but as part of the many entries in the table.
D is correct

comments.content:
correction. 
UI pages are not tracked (although the back-end view of a UI page record is tracked)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
UI pages and other non-standard interfaces not tracked

Selected Answer: B
B is correct
B is the correct answer
B is correct
Correct. UI pages and other non-standard interfaces not tracked

E doesn't make any sense. D is correct

Common Service Data Model (CSDM) product view

discussion.content: D is correct

Selected Answer: D
Common Service Data Model (CSDM) product view is the resource used to view details of the tables and configuration items (CIs) associated with a particular use case in ServiceNow. The CSDM provides a framework for organizing, defining, and visualizing an organization's services and related data. It helps to provide a common language and structure to facilitate communication between IT and business stakeholders, as well as to ensure that data is consistent and accurate across the organization.

questions.question_text: What resource can you use to view details of the tables and configuration items (CIs) associated with a particular use case?
